alert.note: Alert for Haywood (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 26 at 12:39PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Haywood County in western North Carolina. * WHEN...Until 500 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1236 PM EDT, Rainfall amounts will continue to pile up along the Blue Ridge Parkway and throughout the headwaters of the Pigeon River this afternoon. Remain alert for rising stream and river levels and possibly the flooding of low- lying areas. - Some locations that may experience flooding today include... Blue Ridge Parkway from Black Balsam To Mount Pisgah, Graveyard Fields, Black Balsam Area, Mount Pisgah, Sunburst and Cruso. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please report flooding or landslides threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via Twitter using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed.
